Fields.DialogueText: Usagi-san! You left meal time hastily. Is something the matter?
*Usagi squawks*
Ara ara, please do not damage the floor, Usagi-san. Hai, come to onee-chan.
What's the matter with Usagi-san, Fubuki?
She is acting rather strange lately, Kanchou. Wherever there is a metal substance, she consistently pecks on the object without hesitation. I am unsure if this is normal crane behavior.

Fields.MenuText: Should we ask the on-call doctor to be safe?
Cranes peck when they are trying to protect something. Could she be protecting you?
I hear cranes exhibit this behavior when they are agitated.

Fields.DialogueText: That seems wise. I will call him up in the next hour.
Usagi-san is overprotective, just like Miyuki. There could be a chance this is the case in our predicament.
Are you certain? I have not heard such knowledge before. Perhaps you should reread your encyclopedia again?
The peculiar thing about Usagi-san is that she has been leaving and returning back to me.
What's odd about that?
Usagi-san has not considered leaving my side up until recently.
Strange. I hate to suggest this, but maybe she is remembering her instincts and returning to the wild.
Usagi-san would not return if that circumstance is true.
This is odd. Try not to worry too much, Fubuki. The on-call doctor is familiar with wild animals. I hear he spent ten years studying red-crowned cranes.
Hai, he has told me, Kanchou.
Augh, Morganas are spotted due west. Don't worry, Fubuki. We'll figure out what's wrong with her.
Hai, Kanchou.
@BATTLE
For Miyuki, Usagi-san! Let Kanchou blow the horagai!
Ack! Easy with the throwing, Usagi-san. Um...  How do I do this, Fubuki?
Ah, let me demonstrate for you first. Grip your hand to the inner part of the conch shell, like so.
Next, flatten your lips and leave a small gap of air in between the bottom and upper lip.
Finally, puff out the air in a glorious trumpet that let your enemies know your presence.
Barooooooooooo!
Hai, Kanchou. Your turn.
I'll give it my best.
Ano...  Your lips are not--
Sprrrrrrffttttttt... ..
Sorry, that was my first time. Usagi-san! Ow! Quit it! ...  Let's just chase some Morganas away.
@BATTLE
Kanchou, as a role model to the Nagano no Kami, it is imperative you learn the battle cry of our people. Onegaishimasu. Allow me to instruct you when there are no Funayūrei present.

Fields.MenuText: Sure, I would love to learn from you.
Easier now that there's no cannon fire screaming past my ears.
If Usagi-san stops pecking me.

Fields.DialogueText: Arigatō. Miyuki would be ashamed to have heard that call though.
Miyuki learned a lot with the shouting of men around her. If she can do it, so can you.
I have no control of the reincarnation of my sister.
Speaking of which, what was Miyuki like? You told me she was hard headed, but what else?
Hm... I was the more quiet and attentive one of our family. Miyuki was, lack of a better word, a rebel and sometimes acted like the onee-san, big sister, believe it or not.
Defense was the top priority for her, unlike me. If someone breached the defense, she would become extremely volatile to put down that threat.
Amazing. I would have been honored to meet her.
Hehe! In essence, you already have with Usagi-san.
Hah, how could I forget?
*Usagi honks*
Hey, be happy I got you fresh reeds this time!
*Usagi squawks and pecks at the Captain*
Ow, ow, ow...
Right now she wants mackerel, not reeds, Kanchou...
Kanchou, after these Funayūrei are dealt with, "wood" you like to talk?
Sure I wou-- Wait, did you just make a pun?
I was taught a variety of words that can transform into puns.
@BATTLE
Sumimasen. I made a poor pun earlier.
Ah, don't worry about it. Glad you're learning new things, Fubuki.
Arigatō.
Now what did you want to ask me?
I need freshly cut oak logs, Kanchou.
For what?
For confidentiality reasons, I cannot allow anyone to know.

Fields.MenuText: I trust you enough by now that it's not for a wasteful reason.
... Now I'm curious.
As long as it doesn't cut into our budget...

Fields.DialogueText: Arigatō, Kanchou. Ten thousand uses for an oak log, and I shall not use any that are wasteful.
Onegaishimasu. Please maintain this confidentiality. It is highly secretive for now, Kanchou.
It does not. The next time we are in a port that is correctly filled with deciduous oak trees, it will not take long to harvest the wood.
Sure, I'll let you have the oak log. Doesn't seem it will do anyone any harm.
Arigatō, Kanchou.
Captain, we have received reports from the north that there is a huge blockade of Morganas up ahead.
Augh... Fubuki?
Shhh...
Oh, sorry.
Uh... apologies, I will take my leave for now, Captain.
Fub--
You require my thoughts, I am aware, Kanchou. But, I do not agree with your plan.
I didn't say my plan yet.
You think it is suicide to head in the direction of the blockade. Is that correct?
Well, yes.
I propose you go straight to this blockade. Something is amiss in this situation. Why would a concentration of Funayūrei be that large?

Fields.MenuText: They are guarding something?
Their base is nearby?
The Morganas are performing erratic behavior to throw us off?

Fields.DialogueText: Certainly a possibility, Kanchou.
There is no evidence or intelligence suggesting that they have a base to begin with, Kanchou.
... Not a bad guess, Kanchou.
The blockade is for a reason, Kanchou. We cannot learn from anything in life by avoiding the enemy. It is as if you are running away from a storm.
Go to this blockade and discover the reason for this formation.
Kanchou, I am with you. You have nothing to fear.
Thanks, Fubuki. I trust you.
@BATTLE
Hurry! Oh... Kanchou!
What? What's wrong, Fubuki?! I came as soon as I heard your cry...
Look! The display lamps are lighting up. Let me write this down. EVLR VLAQ OCMH XBYV NZGJ APSZ KCXG CIAY AKCI LYDU...
We need the Enigma machine and cryptologist. Fast!
Wait, where did we get an Enigma machine? I thought they belonged to the German forces.
Before the Funayūrei arrived, I gathered resources from the Polish, British, and German superiors about the Enigma machine.
It was difficult at first, as if fighting in a snowstorm without even a hizakake to keep warm.
But when the Funayūrei arrived, they were more... giving of the information.
Kanchou, I am off to inform the cryptologist and will get the results soon. If Funayūrei arrive, I will meet you on deck after I find the cryptologist.
Hurry!
@BATTLE
Fubuki? What was the message?
It was... a threat and an invitation, Kanchou.

Fields.MenuText: What do you mean?
A threat?
An invitation?

Fields.DialogueText: The message we saw earlier, Kanchou.
An extremely disturbing one, at that.
They beckon to us.
This message is most likely sent by... by Miyuki, Kanchou. No other would communicate via Enigma machine and code like Miyuki. Funayūrei communicate at a different level than this.
They do, but I wouldn't be surprised if they were using the display lamps as well.
We must address this, Kanchou.
Of course. We sail in the coordinates this message gave us.
Hai.
Usagi-san? What did you bring me?
*Usagi sets a bucket from her mouth in front of Fubuki*
Ara ara, you brought me so much snow, leaves, and red berries!
What is all of this, Fubuki?!
Kanchou, mite kudasai. Usagi-san brought a bucket full of snow and earthen accessories.
Accessories?
Do you remember that farmer that taught me how to raise plants? He showed me photos of their family playing in the snow.
Small lumps in the snow with red berries and leaves. They called them yuki usagi. "Snow bunny." We have to make a group of them in honor of Usagi-san!

Fields.MenuText: Sounds fun! I would love to help out!
You won't be sad if the snow melts?
Where are we going to display the bunnies?

Fields.DialogueText: Arigatō gozaimasu! Here is the picture of the yuki usagi for reference, Kanchou.
Īe. The climate in the Farm is cold enough to keep the little snow usagis for a long time.
Along the borders inside the Farm, Kanchou.
Ah... It will have to wait. Funayūrei have us surrounded.
@BATTLE
Usagi-san!? Usagi-san! Doko desu ka?
@BATTLE
Usagi-san...
Fubuki? What's wrong?
Usagi-san is missing...
You sure she didn't fly off and will come back again?
Īe. Before she leaves, she always nudges my cheek. This time, she did not do that at all...

Fields.MenuText: We will find her. Don't worry, Fubuki.
I'm here for you, Fubuki. What do you want me to do right now that will help you?
She will come back, Fubuki. Believe in her.

Fields.DialogueText: Arigatō, Kanchou. I know we will, but my heart cannot stop this pain at this moment in time... .
Can you search the rest of the ship? She could be trapped somewhere.
Usagi-san could be in danger, Kanchou.
I will do what I can for you, Fubuki. In the meantime, do everything you can to call Usagi-san to you. I already miss her pecking on my head...
Heh...
*ALARM*
Fubuki? Can you come down to your Farm, please?
Hai, Kanchou.
Ah, feeling bad right now, Fubuki?
Given the circumstances, Captain.
I thought this would cheer you up. I chopped an oak tree that was growing right outside of our last port.
Arigatō...

Fields.MenuText: I know it's not Usagi-san, but I thought I could start with the little things.
Usagi-san will come back, Fubuki.
Fubuki...

Fields.DialogueText: Can you make it become Usagi-san? Gomen-ne. I know that is not possible and I am just lashing out on you.
What if she does not? What will I do?... Gomen-ne.
Gomen-ne. My heart is filled with ice at the moment, Kanchou.
No, don't apologize, Fubuki. I understand this pain isn't easy. That's why I'm still here to help as best as I can.
Arigatō, Kanchou. I may not show it now, but I am eternally grateful for your friendship.
No, thank you for allowing me to still be friends with you, Fubuki.
@BATTLE
Kanchou.
Hello, Fubuki. How are you feeling right now?
Actually, I-- Whoa! The deck is so slippery! Whoooaaaa... Aaaah!
Fubuki!? Careful, you're about to go over the--
Kanchou!
Come on, I got you. Get yourself up, please, Fubuki. I cannot hold on forever.
Kanchou. You can let go of me.
No, don't give up!
There.

Fields.MenuText: Sorry... I just thought for a second I lost you.
I forgot. I'm sorry, Fubuki.
Fubuki, you are one of my best friends. I will always try to leap in to save your life if need be.

Fields.DialogueText: Do not apologize. The fact you were even worried brings joy to my heart.
There is nothing to apologize over, Kanchou, you were merely reacting out of instinct.
I am honored you think that, Kanchou. Arigatō. You are also my best friend, Captain.
*ALARM*
Oh, the alarms. Glad we're on deck to begin with.
I would advise the crew members to use less wax on the deck, though.
I'll inform them...
@BATTLE
I'm fine now. You forgot I am a Nagano no Kami. I can manifest back to anywhere near or on the ship. There is no need to be alarmed.
Morgana patrol on approach!
@BATTLE
Are we on course to the coordinates, Kanchou?
We are, Fubuki.
Hm, the breeze feels wonderful today. I wonder... Chotto matte, kudasai. Stop the destroyer at once, Kanchou.
Engines back two-thirds... and... there. All stop. Fubuki, we're dead in the water right here.
That is fine, Kanchou. Arigatō. Please wait here.
What the?! Why are you bringing a body on board?!
Kanchou... This is Tōru-san. From Miyuki's crew.
What? Are you sure?
Hai. I cannot explain it, but it's him. The contents of his pockets, and this unique bracelet on the wrist. I know this man was one of Miyuki's favorites.
And now, here he is... dead.

Fields.MenuText: Are you one hundred percent certain this is him?
How in the heck could Miyuki have a favorite? She wasn't even a Belle, right?
What do you think this means?

Fields.DialogueText: Hai. Trust me when I say this is him, Kanchou. I can feel it in my...
He loved that ship. She loved him back. I can just... feel it.
That the Enigma code, Usagi-san's disappearance, and Tōru-san's death is all connected back to Miyuki.
Fubuki, remember the lilies you bought in port? Maybe you can scatter them at sea when bury Tōru-san at sea. Again.
Arigatō. "May you be free from suffering." We will commit him to the sea with tranquility - on better terms than when he died aboard my doomed sister.
Sayonara, Tōru-san...
Please don't say "bones" right now. Please.
Īe, Kanchou.
It is as though I share memories - and their attached emotions - with my sister-ship, Kanchou. I can sense the truth of this relationship with Miyuki.
And now his remains ended up all the way out here? Too strange - but we will respect him.
Sigh...
Fubuki? Are you in here?
Ohairi kudasai.
One of the crew saw you were down and decided to raise money for you.
... I cannot travel outside to the market stalls.
You didn't let me finish, Fubuki. They raised that money to get you... this!
Huh? Matcha? Ceremonial grade matcha?!
Yup! The most expensive matcha around. The men told me it has a sweeter flavor than lower grade matchas.
I am... impressed. I wish Usagi-san would drink this, too...

Fields.MenuText: You will see her again, Fubuki.
Cranes drink tea?
She will love it, Fubuki, and then peck my scalp for fun.

Fields.DialogueText: Arigatō, Kanchou, for being my support throughout this arduous time.
Why not?
Ha! Then she will eat the mackerel I have hiding in the back.
There, there...
Funayūrei are approaching, Kanchou...
@BATTLE
Let's head up to the bridge, Fubuki!
Funayūrei are coming from-- What?!
Fubuki, did you see that?
Hai. Funayūrei passed us without a single attack upon our fleet. Like hares running from a kitsune.
What's going on?
Kanchou, they were approaching, then changed course directly away... away from the coordinates we received earlier.

Fields.MenuText: That is extremely unsettling.
We're still heading there, right?
Are you sure you still want to do this, Fubuki?

Fields.DialogueText: Hai... Miyuki is terrifying in battle, but to have Funayūrei flee from her direction...
We are, Kanchou. If Miyuki is there, we have to find her. If she is not, we make a swift shot and leave like planned.
Hai. It is final, Kanchou. Please do not ask again.
I understand. If this is Miyuki, promise me you will not lose your life trying to save or kill her.
Fubuki!
I do not know if I am able to make that promise, Kanchou.
Fubuki... trust me, please.
And you still think your sister, Miyuki, is connected to those coordinates.
Hai.
... And turn us about. We need to take care of those Morganas before they get in raiding range of land.
@BATTLE
Do you know how much further?
According to the coordinates, we should be... Oh!
Hm?
Listen closely...
*the radio crackles: "Wan wan! That's right! Go back home, you dogs! Suck back on the tits, you cowardly bitches!"*
That's... It's her voice.. but something's wrong... Miyuki was rebellious, but would not be this insolent.
*the voice continues: "ARA ARA! Won't you come play with my ship, Funayūrei?! BANG! Headshot! HAHAHA! GIVE ME A TASTE OF YOUR BLOOD!"*
Oh no... She is in a battle with Morganas?! This...
What is happening?
She's attacking Morganas... and now she's targeting a cargo ship...
*more radio communications: "Are you thinking of getting away from hurting me?! Why don't you come along and FEEL MY PAIN! BANG BANG!"*
No!... Miyuki stop this at once! This is your onee-san speaking! Stop this insolence!
*a scream comes across the radio static: "UGAAAAAAAAAA!"*

Fields.MenuText: Fubuki, we must fall back for now!
Miyuki isn't going to listen, Fubuki.
What about the cargo ship, Fubuki?

Fields.DialogueText: We are so close, Kanchou.
I am not leaving her like this, Kanchou!
Kanchou, we have to act, now!
*evil voice on the radio: "Ara ara. More idiots falling in my trap. Well, I can't do all the dirty work. CAAAAAACKLE!"*
Kanchou!
Stay with me, Fubuki! We got Morganas swarming at us from all directions. Get them away from us, and fall back!
@BATTLE
Kanchou, we are going back to Miyuki.
That location is dangerous.
Did you not hear her cry earlier? It sounded similar to, if not exactly, like Usagi-san's. I implore you, we must investigate. Immediately, Kanchou.
Understood. I'll stand by you till the end, Fubuki. You know that, right.
Hai.
*Some Time Later*
Something... smells familiar.
What is that?
Oh no.
*radio crackles to life: "Well, hello there. Didn't think you would come back to my party. I'm about to serve up something really good."*
Miyuki, if you have Usagi-san...
You mean the crane? She was my spy, trained by one of my crew members. Fascinating how you can learn your enemy so well, even from a bird.
You...
*radio voice contunes: "I have no more use for that ugly bird any longer. Say goodbye! I'm skinning her alive..."*
Oh fu--
USAGI-SAN! NO! LET HER GO THIS INSTANT!

Fields.MenuText: Stop this instant, Miyuki!
Skin me alive, not the poor bird!
Let her go, you monster!

Fields.DialogueText: Miyuki, please listen to your sister! Stop this!
Do not encourage her, Kanchou!
I WILL END YOU IF MAKE ANOTHER MOVE ON USAGI-SAN!
*On the radio: "CREEEEEEEEEEEEEE!"*
USA-GI-SAAAAAAAN!!!
*Miyuki's voice continues: "Oh, she didn't have much meat on her. Can't serve this at the party. Out it goes into the ocean!" (splash)*
Uwaaaaaaaah!
You will pay for this, Miyuki!
She's lured the Morganas back, Fubuki. We have multiple enemy contacts closing on us!
Kanchou...
@BATTLE
Fubuki? Fubuki?! Crap... She wouldn't do anything drastic, right? Fubuki! Right, the Farm!
Fubuki?!
Hai.
Come here. I got worried about you after we got out of there. You disappeared entirely...
Gomen-ne.
Fubuki... What are you doing?
Yuki usagi.
Oh, right. You wanted to make them before. Can I make them with you?
Hai. Douzo.
Arigatō.

Fields.MenuText: Your bunny looks a lot better than mine.
Do you have any more leaves?
Let's pair our bunnies together.

Fields.DialogueText: Arigatō.
Hai, douzo.
... Mattaku...
Fubuki... I know I have been pestering you about this, but I'm still here for you as your shoulder and someone that messes up on your conch shell.
I'm not your biological sibling, pet, or anything like that but... I do know, I am me that wants to support you to the very end.
That much I know is true and here to stay.
Arigatō, Kanchou.
Sorry to lecture you. Let's get back to making more bunnies and decorating the Farm up real nice. All right?
Hai. But it must wait. We have Funayūrei approaching...
@BATTLE
Fubuki?
What is it, Kanchou?
I know you're not doing well, but there are plenty of Morganas coming our way and we can use your help.
I will help, Kanchou. Sorry to be an inconvenience to you.
Not at all, Fubuki. We're best friends, remember?
@BATTLE
Augh, why did I bother carrying all of this in one trip... Uh, Fubuki? Can you help me with these documents.
I will assist you to the best of my ability.

Fields.MenuText: You're thinking of flipping over the documents again?
Thank you for the help, Fubuki.
I'm glad to have you around when I need you, Fubuki.

Fields.DialogueText: Īe.
You're welcome...
You're welcome, Captain...
Come on, Fubuki. You know you want to flip over the papers we're carrying.
(grins... then dumps the papers on to the deck)
Feel better?
It is... beautiful.
Right? It's all chaotic but... we can see and appreciate all the patterns the papers produce and focus on the beauty of the other objects in this room.
Kanchou.
Yeah?
Arigatō. For your kindness. Everything you have done so far.
I'd do anything to help you, Fubuki. You know that. Now come on! Let's see what you can make out of this pile!
What are you thinking about?
Funayūrei. The approaching ones, of course.
@BATTLE
Before that combat, how did you know I was thinking and not meditating?
You only meditate in chairs or against a wall. Standing is not a suitable place for you to meditate.
Heh. You are starting to understand me well.
What were you thinking about?
Miyuki.
After all the horrific deeds she has done, I have to consider what I promised in the beginning. To put an end to her misery and let her finally sleep.
However, we should also defend her if a Funayūrei were to attack her.
Wait. You don't want to kill her? What about what you said?!
My feelings... changed.

Fields.MenuText: Don't act like that. The Fubuki I knew would see through her word the end.
Why did your feelings change?
You don't sound confident, even with this new change.

Fields.DialogueText: This Fubuki has... changed.
Because, I do not know.
Of course I am! Probably.
Fubuki, this is not you. The Fubuki I know would be resolute to her decisions, throughout all the opposition.
You are correct, Kanchou. I will meditate on it. Usagi-san... was always near me...
Here. I'll sit with you.
Think again if you are trying to cross this kori no yona kaze! Battle stations, Kanchou!
@BATTLE
Hello, Fubuki.
Please come with me to the Farm. Oh, and close your eyes as well. Take my hand. There we go. To the left. Hai, me o hanashite kudasai.
Oh, this is wonderful!
The mushrooms grown on this oak log make wonderful nabe. Please, take a seat on that oak log.

Fields.MenuText: You made all of this yourself?
Wait, does the chef know you've been taking a lot of his ingredients?
There are so many kinds of mushrooms in this pot!

Fields.DialogueText: Hai. This is why it was a surprise, Kanchou.
Īe. What few ingredients were not mushrooms, the farmers in port have provided.
There are. Here are enoki, shiitake, oyster, white, maitake... .
Wait, Fubuki. I thought you wanted to give out the food you grow to the people at the port?
I still do, Kanchou. But then I remembered, it is important to keep your Kanchou content, too.
I cared for Usagi-san all this time, and you have taken care of me. Now, it is my turn.
Fubuki...
Hai, I gave you a big helping. Please regain your strength and vigor with this stew.
Thanks for thinking of me, Fubuki. This is absolutely scrumptious! What's the secret ingredient? I taste something... sweet...
Oh, the secret ingredient is...
... a secret. Ha!
Time for some Morgana scrapping!
@BATTLE
Kanchou, we are returning to Miyuki's location once more.
I understand now I have no domain on Miyuki's ship, but I do have control on my own. Thus, I will protect you with my life, Kanchou.
Usagi-san would have wanted that, whether she was a spy or not.
I'll never forget the first time I babysat her... Took me forever to heal the holes in my head.
*radio crackles with Miyuki's voice: "Oooh, mite mite. One of the dogs came running back! Don't worry, nasty pup. I'll take you somewhere dark..."*
Miyuki-chan!
*Fubuki raises the conch horn to her lips*
Bar-oooooooooooooooo-OOOOOOO!
... Huff... .Huff... Huff... .
*Miyuki's voice on the radio: "Why in the seven hells were you making all that ruckus?! You want to a place to make all that shitty noise? I will gladly..."*

Fields.MenuText: Uh, Fubuki?! What are you doing?
She didn't recognize your call. What do we do now?
We have to pull back now!

Fields.DialogueText: I am just... saddened, Captain.
Maa... ii ka.
Maa... ii ka.
We should withdraw for now and wait, Kanchou.
I concur, Fubuki. Stay at battle stations just in case.
Fubuki, I...
Wakatteru. There is only so much we can do, especially as her only sister that is alive and awoken.
Yet, please, let me go see her again, Kanchou. One last time. I need to tell her how I feel, even if she is gone.
I understand, but after we do that... we must make the final blow on Miyuki.
Hai, Kanchou.
*radio crackles with a taunting voice: "Ara ara, you REALLY love to get your ass kicked by me and the Funayūrei. Prepare for your beating!*
Miyuki, please. As your sister, please just stop this.
*the radio remains silent...*
Listen to me, Miyuki. Do you remember when were younger? Do you remember the photos of winter?
Do you remember how sick I was when we first went to see a winter landscape and you comforted me?
You said, "Daijobu? Miyuki-chan will always look out for you. Smile, even if it is winter. Hai, Fubuki?"
You made me love the snow and we always talked about making yuki usagis! Please... just come back to me, sister.
Fubuki...
*radio screeches: "What in blazes are you talking about? All I'm doing is getting you away from a place I love!"*
*radio continues: "Have you seen the Funayūrei that left each time you come here? I'm the baddest ship alive! I get to destroy everything, even you, if I so choose. Now, SCRAM!"*
... Wakarimashita.

Fields.MenuText: You're gonna just let her go?
Wait, that's it?
She's not coming with us?

Fields.DialogueText: Hai. Let us depart, Kanchou.
Hai.
Īe.
Miyuki! Kori no yona kaze. Together! Always!
*radio: ".. Get outta here! ..."*
Heh. Hai, hai.
Morganas, Fubuki...
@BATTLE
You seem all right after everything that just happened.
Heh. Yup!
Care to inform me?
Hehe! It is really my sister, Kanchou. It may not seem like it to you, but my sister lives on still.
Watashi wa shiawase.
I don't get it... She killed Usagi-san, Tōru-san, and a bunch of innocent lives, yet you seem happy over everything and as if their deaths mean nothing.
Kanchou, listen. Do you remember what she said? She was keeping people away from a place she loves. The only place we talked about all the time was Hokkaido.
Her last thoughts it seems when she was still herself must have been about keeping people and entities from harming the place we cared about, Hokkaido.
Fubuki, I'm not catching on here at all.
In other words, my sister is still my sister... but in a more euphoric state. From what it appears to me anyway.

Fields.MenuText: Again, your sister killed people, Fubuki.
You do realize she has risen from the ocean floor, right?
Fubuki, I don't understand...

Fields.DialogueText: I do not ignore that fact, Kanchou.
I know that, Kanchou.
I am a patient teacher, Kanchou.
Kanchou, I am going to protect my sister. I failed to protect her once, and now I will protect her again.
Fubuki, this is madness... but right now we need to concentrate on these Morganas.
@BATTLE
Fubuki, we are not allowing Miyuki to live. There are too many people that will be killed by her if she is allowed to stay upon Hokkaido's borders.
Kanchou, with all due respect, you do not understand how it is when your sibling comes back from the dead.
I understand that millions of lives are now at stake with her roaming free. Command will agree.
Miyuki is actually contributing a lot to our cause. Have you thought about that?
Explain it to me, please.
You have noticed that Funayūrei flee from Miyuki. She lures them in with Enigma code and acts as if Funayūrei are sinking or in distress.
Destroying cargo and commercial ships is awful, but this way she lures Funayūrei is wasting a lot of their time and resources.
Perhaps she could show us more efficient ways to take out the Funayūrei.
Miyuki will not admit it, but she is helping us more than she is hurting us at this moment in time.
So you're saying we can use her as a decoy?
You may not agree on an emotional level, but you can at least agree with me that she is important right now from a military standpoint.

Fields.MenuText: I'm on board.
I don't have much choice but to agree.
This is messed up, but it can work.

Fields.DialogueText: You were always understanding, Kanchou.
Hai.
Arigatō, Kanchou, for doing your best to understand.
So you and the crew agree to not kill Miyuki?
Fubuki, keep this in mind. If she does try to kill you, I will kill her.
I can’t afford to gamble with my sanity if you disappear from my life.
Hai, I can agree to those terms, Kanchou.
@BATTLE
"So in conclusion, please avoid these areas in the future until we deal with this ship." Ready to transmit that?
Got it, ma'am. I'll let you know as soon as Command acknowledges.
Glad the rest of the team is accepting this.
Hai... I am shocked myself.
Speaking of which, we still do not know how or why this happened.

Fields.MenuText: There has to be a connection to the Morganas to this incident.
We may never know...
I hope Miyuki isn't suffering.

Fields.DialogueText: There could be. Perhaps we should ask a Belle like Leningrad for assistance.
Ma... ii ka. As long as we keep tabs on Miyuki, we might know some day. Until then, it is merely observation.
If she were, her cries would be a lot more agonizing. I have heard other Funayūrei and what they had to say was a lot worse than Miyuki's.
Anyway, my legacy of Miyuki is over... for now. Part of my promise is upheld, it seems.
You're doing a good deed right now.
Time for another. Funayūrei are approaching.
@BATTLE
Did you hear the rumor, Kanchou?
Been busy with a lot of reports and paperwork, Fubuki.
Then listen to this!
To what?
Sugawara Denju Tenarai Kagami. Kazuo Hasegawa.
For some reason, that reminds me of a song title...
Īe. Kazuo Hasegawa is now an actor, but he worked at kabuki acting when he was younger. Someone on board... has some of Kazuo Hasegawa's kabuki makeup.

Fields.MenuText: What? Why would you want his makeup?
What role was he in kabuki acting?
What was the play he was in when he did kabuki acting?

Fields.DialogueText: Do you not understand? The fact he no longer does kabuki means that his makeup is priceless.
He was Kan Shusai in the play Sugawara Denju Tenarai Kagami.
Sugawara Denju Tenarai Kagami. If you ever get the opportunity, I implore you to see it.
That makeup would be quite the collector's item, so... I am off to snoop! Stealthily and suavely, I might add.
Heh. Welcome back, Fubuki. Welcome back.
Kanchou?
Fubuki, I'm here! What is going on?
Hai. (removes a piece of jewelry... her kanzashi)
Isn't this-?
Miyuki's, and was my, kanzashi flower hair pin. I want you to have it, Kanchou.
This feels sudden. Why now?
Miyuki would be sad if anyone forgot who she was. Unlike most of the Nagano no Kami, I am realistic to the effects of war.
If I were to perish, no one would remember who Miyuki was.
Of course people would. You have told everyone your story about Miyuki so they stay away from her line of fire.
Heh. That is true. But, I want my best friend to remember her, in a way that I would.
I can speak on behalf of Miyuki, Usagi-san, Tōru-san, and even Inazuma - you cared about the lives you have touched and want to remember them, whether they live or die.
So, please, accept the kanzashi and the legacy of the Fubuki lineage. Shin'yu. My best friend.

Fields.MenuText: I am honored to, Fubuki. Arigatō.
Hai, I will gladly, Fubuki.
Hai, hai, Shin'yu.

Fields.DialogueText: Heh. You are most welcome, Kanchou.
Thank... you, Kanchou, for taking this responsibility.
Hehe! Well said, Kanchou!
Oh, Fubuki. Before you left Miyuki, what were you saying to her? I never did ask you about that.
Miyuki's name means "beautiful snow" and my name means "blizzard." Together, we formed a bond we named kori no yona kaze.
Without her, there would be no beautiful snow to scatter across the world. And she cannot live without me for I carry her beautiful snow within my arms.
That, Kanchou, is a sister I will undoubtedly continue to carry her passion through the winds. She is, after all, my baby sister.
Beautiful, Fubuki. Thanks for that.
Ah, paperwork. My most unrelenting foe.
*ALARM*
... With the obvious exception. Dammit.
@BATTLE
